laboratory_examinations.findings: Bilateral, apical fibrocavific disease consistent with tuberculosis.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Induced sputum, urine, and gastric washings
laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for acid-fast bacteria by smear and culture.
Mild anemiaâ€”hemoglobin 11 g/dL; red blood cells per liter: 5.57; special smear showed marked microcytosis, moderate poikilocytosis, and hypochromia.

Elevated liver function enzymes: aspartate aminotransferase 73 U/L (normal 12-31 U/L), alanine aminotransferase 67 U/L (normal 9-29 U/L), gamma glutamyl-transferase 42 U/L (normal 6-29 U/L); bilirubin values were normal.
Demonstrated a diffusely coarse echo consistent with cirrhosis; splenomegaly was also noted.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Biopsy of the right knee lesion
laboratory_examinations.findings: Revealed a lobular, granulomatous pathologic picture consistent with erythema induratum.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: PCR study of leg biopsy tissue
